      • runMethod

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> runMethod(java.lang.Object instance,
                                           java.lang.String method,
                                           java.lang.Class<T> expectedType,
                                           java.lang.Object... args)
        Attempts to get the return value of a method which may not be publicly accessible (e.g. protected or private). If the method does not exist, or throws a exception the caught is wrapped in a Exceptional. Otherwise the (nullable) return value is returned wrapped in a Exceptional.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the expected return value
        Parameters:
        instance - The instance to call the method on
        method - The method to call
        expectedType - The type of the expected return value
        args - The arguments which are provided to the method call
        Returns:
        The result of the method call, wrapped in Exceptional

      • runMethod

        public static <T> Exceptional<T> runMethod(java.lang.Class<?> methodHolder,
                                           java.lang.Object instance,
                                           java.lang.String method,
                                           java.lang.Class<T> expectedType,
                                           java.lang.Class<?>[] argumentTypes,
                                           java.lang.Object... args)
        Attempts to get the return value of a method which may not be publicly accessible (e.g. protected or private). If the method does not exist, or throws a exception the caught is wrapped in a Exceptional. Otherwise the (nullable) return value is returned wrapped in a Exceptional.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the expected return value
        Parameters:
        methodHolder - The type to call the method on
        instance - The instance to call the method with
        method - The method to call
        expectedType - The type of the expected return value
        argumentTypes - The types of the arguments, used to collect the appropriate method
        args - The arguments which are provided to the method call
        Returns:
        The result of the method call, wrapped in Exceptional

      • assignableFrom

        public static boolean assignableFrom(java.lang.Class<?> to,
                                     java.lang.Class<?> from)
        Returns true if to is equal to-, a super type of, or a primitive wrapper of from.

        Primitive wrappers include all JDK wrappers for native types (int, char, double, etc). E.g. all of the following assignabilities return true: 

        
 SeleneUtils.assignableFrom(int.class, Integer.class);
 SeleneUtils.assignableFrom(Integer.class, int.class);
 SeleneUtils.assignableFrom(int.class, int.class);
 SeleneUtils.assignableFrom(Number.class, Integer.class);
        Parameters:
        to - The possible (super) type or primite wrapper of from
        from - The type to compare assignability against
        Returns:
        true if to is equal to-, a super type of, or a primitive wrapper of from
        See Also:
        isPrimitiveWrapper(Class, Class)

      • isPrimitiveWrapper

        public static boolean isPrimitiveWrapper(java.lang.Class<?> targetClass,
                                         java.lang.Class<?> primitive)
        Returns true if targetClass is a primitive wrapper of primitive.
        Parameters:
        targetClass - The primitive wrapper (e.g. Integer)
        primitive - The primitive type (e.g. int)
        Returns:
        true if targetClass is a primitive wrapper of primitive.

      • annotatedMethods

        @NotNull
public static <A extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> @NotNull @Unmodifiable java.util.Collection<java.lang.reflect.Method> annotatedMethods(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                                                                                                                           java.lang.Class<A> annotation,
                                                                                                                                                           java.util.function.Predicate<A> rule)
        Gets all methods annotated by a given annotation, which match the given rule, inside a class. If the method is not annotated with the given annotation, or does not match the given rule, it will not be returned. Also collects methods from parent types of the class.
        Type Parameters:
        A - The annotation constraint
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to scan for methods
        annotation - The annotation expected to be present on one or more methods
        rule - The additional rule for methods to match
        Returns:
        All methods annotated by a given annotation, which match the given rule.

      • annotatedMethods

        @NotNull
public static <A extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> @NotNull @Unmodifiable java.util.Collection<java.lang.reflect.Method> annotatedMethods(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
                                                                                                                                                           java.lang.Class<A> annotation,
                                                                                                                                                           java.util.function.Predicate<A> rule,
                                                                                                                                                           boolean skipParents)
        Gets all methods annotated by a given annotation, which match the given rule, inside a class. If the method is not annotated with the given annotation, or does not match the given rule, it will not be returned. Also collects methods from parent types of the class if skipParents is false.
        Type Parameters:
        A - The annotation constraint
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class to scan for methods
        annotation - The annotation expected to be present on one or more methods
        rule - The additional rule for methods to match
        skipParents - Whether or not to include methods in parent types
        Returns:
        All methods annotated by a given annotation, which match the given rule.

      • annotatedTypes

        public static <A extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<?>> annotatedTypes(java.lang.String prefix,
                                                                                                                  java.lang.Class<A> annotation)
        Gets types annotated with a given annotation, both classes and annotations. The prefix is typically a package. If the annotation is present on a parent of the type, the highest level member will be included.
        Type Parameters:
        A - The annotation constraint
        Parameters:
        prefix - The package prefix
        annotation - The annotation expected to be present on one or more types
        Returns:
        The annotated types

      • annotatedTypes

        public static <A extends java.lang.annotation.Annotation> java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<?>> annotatedTypes(java.lang.String prefix,
                                                                                                                  java.lang.Class<A> annotation,
                                                                                                                  boolean skipParents)
        Gets types annotated with a given annotation, both classes and annotations. The prefix is typically a package. If the annotation is present on a parent of the type, it will only be included if skipParents is false.
        Type Parameters:
        A - The annotation constraint
        Parameters:
        prefix - The package prefix
        annotation - The annotation expected to be present on one or more types
        skipParents - Whether or not to include the type if supertypes are annotated
        Returns:
        The annotated types

      • subTypes

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<? extends T>> subTypes(java.lang.String prefix,
                                                                              java.lang.Class<T> parent)
        Gets all sub-types of a given type. The prefix is typically a package. If no sub-types exist for the given type, and empty list is returned.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the parent
        Parameters:
        prefix - The package prefix
        parent - The parent type to scan for subclasses
        Returns:
        The list of sub-types, or a empty list
